thread.title: Kaitlyn Bristowe Slams ‘Bachelor’ Producers For Blocking Her ‘DWTS’ Offer
thread.title_full: Kaitlyn Bristowe Slams ‘Bachelor’ Producers For Blocking Her ‘DWTS’ Offer

author: Samantha Lear
title: Kaitlyn Bristowe Slams ‘Bachelor’ Producers For Blocking Her ‘DWTS’ Offer
text:
February 27, 2017 by Samantha Lear 0 Shares   many Bachelor Nation-ers might be excited to hear Nick Viall is likely joining   Season 24, Kaitlyn Bristowe is less enthused. 
In fact, the Bachelorette 2015 star seems pretty livid that her ex is getting the gig — but not for the reasons you might think. 
Kaitlyn’s anger is mostly directed at Bachelor showrunner Mike Fleiss, and it all has to do with the DWTS offer she received two years ago. Embed from Getty Images 
It all started on Twitter earlier today, when Kait’s friend (and Bachelor 2015 winner) Whitney Bischoff reacted to the Nick buzz. 
She tweeted, “Why does a bachelorette never get this gig @BachelorABC?!? I wanted to see @kaitlynbristowe shake her tail feather!” @people why does a bachelorette never get this gig @BachelorABC ?!? I wanted to see @kaitlynbristowe shake her tail feather! — Whitney Bischoff (@whitbisch) February 27, 2017 
That spurred her Bachelorette pal to drop a major behind the scenes truth bomb. 
“Actually I was offered it, had the contract,” the former dance teacher responds. “Mike Fliess [sic] told me I wasn't allowed. He said he didnt[sic] want people wanting fame after his show.” Actually I was offered it, had the contract & Mike Fliess told me I wasn't allowed.He said he didnt want people wanting fame after his show https://t.co/nSzricohi4 — Kaitlyn Bristowe (@kaitlynbristowe) February 27, 2017 
Whoa! So why would things change with four-time franchise star Nick? 
Prior to that reveal, Kait alluded to the casting, writing, “What a f*cking joke.” What a f*cking joke — Kaitlyn Bristowe (@kaitlynbristowe) February 27, 2017 
She also warned something might be coming in another tweet. 
“Someone stop me from going on a twitter rant right now,” she added later. Someone stop me from going on a twitter rant right now — Kaitlyn Bristowe (@kaitlynbristowe) February 27, 2017 
The post from Shawn Booth ’s fiancée got many of her followers talking in the comments, pointing out the potential sexist implications of Mike Fleiss’s choice. 
In 21 previous seasons of Bachelor and 12 seasons of Bachelorette , the only stars allowed onto DWTS were four male Bachelors — Nick, Chris Soules , Sean Lowe , and Jake Pavelka — and one female contestant, Melissa Rycroft . 
That has many wondering why it’s OK for male alums to seek “fame after the show,” but not for females to pursue similar opportunities. 
Your move Bach producers!
